image.altText: A police car flashes its lights in front of police tape. Behind is a car on its head with smashed windows.

props.synopsis: Police say the teenager was one of nine people in the car at the time of the crash, with eight others allegedly fleeing the scene on foot.

title.children: Teen dies after allegedly stolen car rolls in Alice Springs CBD in 'disturbing' crash

image.altText: A man with long hair smiling

props.synopsis: The man charged with murdering Victorian woman Samantha Murphy can be revealed as Patrick Orren Stephenson, after his lawyer dropped a bid to have the 22-year-old's name suppressed.

title.children: Patrick Orren Stephenson named as Samantha Murphy's accused killer after suppression order ends

image.altText: A woman holds a yellow teatowel in front of a row of industrial sized washing machines.

props.synopsis: Free, industrial washing machines could be the key to eradicating the surging scourge of scabies in remote communities, where the contagious mite has long contributed to the Indigenous life expectancy gap.Â

title.children: Why communal laundries might be the secret weapon in the NT's fight against scabies

image.altText: An elderly Indigenous man wearing a cowboy hat and purple shirt.

props.synopsis: Peltherre Chris Tomlins will no longer contest the seat of Araluen with the Greens at the upcoming territory election, over posts and comments he made on Facebook that "are not in line" with the party's values.

title.children: NT Greens candidate dumped after Facebook post resurfaces suggesting the government is 'owned' by Zionists

image.altText: Joe Biden, suit with blue tie, using both hands to point to a crowd while speaking.

props.synopsis: From reproductive rights to the state of democracyÂ â the US president has outlined his vision for a second term in his State of the Union address. Look back over our live coverage of the speech.

title.children: Joe Biden sets out his vision in State of the Union address â as it happened

image.altText: storm clouds in the outback

props.synopsis: Years after a new weather radar was promised for the vast Barkly region in the Northern Territory, locals are still waiting and say the delay is causing problems.

title.children: In a land of extremes, this remote NT community has been without a 'critical' weather radar for nearly 10 years

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: It's the case that has captivated the nation, but despite murder charges being laid over the disappearance of Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy, the missing facts about what happened will keep people asking questions.

title.children: Murder charges over Samantha Murphy's disappearance unlikely to stop the questions

image.altText: A man in a shirt, tie and jacket stands with the Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background.

props.synopsis: The headmaster of the private Sydney boys' school, which is preparing to go co-educational, supported a teacher who sent sexually explicit messages to a former female student.

title.children: Cranbrook School headmaster resigns following new revelations about current teacher

image.altText: A woman in the middle of ballot boxes pictured from above.

props.synopsis: There are calls for change to the way Indonesia conducts elections after 115 staff died during and in the days after the country's national poll last month.

title.children: More than 100 officials died after the world's biggest single-day election in Indonesia

image.altText: Josh hazlewood celebrates with teammates

props.synopsis: New Zealand is rolled for just 162 inside two sessions on the first day as Josh Hazlewood takes five wickets at Christchurch's Hagley Oval. Follow live.

title.children: 'It wasn't ideal': Hazlewood five-fa helps skittle New Zealand on day one in Christchurch

image.altText: A composite of Lawler in a red jacket in Parliament, and Potter in a shirt standing outside

props.synopsis: NT Police Minister Brent Potter is under pressure over now-deleted Facebook posts he shared on his profile, which included homophobic and racial slurs and misogynistic language.

title.children: 'He was an idiot': NT chief minister backs police minister after racist Facebook posts

image.altText: A still from a AFLNT match which shows multiple players standing around, one players arm is holding the shirt of an umpire.

props.synopsis: The PINT Football Club player has been suspended for more than a season and deregistered over the altercation, and could be banned from playing for life.

title.children: NTFL player banned for 20 games after hurling young umpire to the ground

image.altText: A woaman in a white coat with long brown hair prepares to toss a coin behind her into the Trevi Fountain

props.synopsis: For hundreds of years, when in Rome, visitors have flocked to the fountain to make a wish, following a storied ritual. Few gave their coins a second thought.Â

title.children: What happens to coins tossed in the Trevi fountain?

image.altText: A police van and forensic crews set up outside a block of units

props.synopsis: Investigations are underway in the northern NSW town of Evans Head after a woman's body was found in a car.Â Police sources say the woman had suffered stab wounds.

title.children: Woman's body found in boot of car, son arrested

image.altText: A little girl, holding an empty white bowl, frowns as she lines up with others who are also holding empty food containers

props.synopsis: A formal conclusion that famine has arrived in Gaza could come next week. But how is a famine officially declared? And as widespread hunger grips the region, why hasn't it been announced already?

title.children: US to build temporary port to deliver Gaza aid as widespread famine looms

image.altText: Samah stands in the middle of the protest crowd, wearing a black and white shirt.

props.synopsis: There are calls to return International Women's Day to its protest roots over fears organisations are placating women in place of addressing gender inequality.

title.children: 'Ask women to get up early and come to something outside work hours': The paradox of International Women's Day

image.altText: A row of white electric vehicles lined up in a showroom.

props.synopsis: ASX closes on another record high, Polestar becomes latest electric vehicle maker to quit Australia's car lobby over the government's proposed CO2 emissions scheme, following Tesla's resignation on Thursday.

title.children: ASX hits another record high, Polestar follows Tesla's lead and quits car lobby over CO2 emissions scheme â as it happened

image.altText: Woman squatting in a field in front of cows

props.synopsis: An Australian charity has significantly expanded its poverty-busting work in rural Cambodia thanks to the generosity of ABC viewers.

title.children: This 'cow bank' is helping Cambodian families leave poverty behind

image.altText: A close up picture of Rupert Murdoch smiling

props.synopsis: It will be the billionaire's fifth wedding, five months after he stepped down from his News Corp media empire.

title.children: Rupert Murdoch engaged again, this time to Elena Zhukova

image.altText: An orange logo with the word TEMU is seen on the screen of a phone held up by a hand in front of ads on a computer

props.synopsis: The cost-of-living crisis has seen Shein and Temu become major players in online retail, but their meteoric rise comes at the expense of local businesses. Is this the end of e-commerce as we know it, or could these brands crash and burn?

title.children: The rise of Temu and Shein in Australia is the result of 'a perfect storm'. Are they here to stay?

image.altText: A woman of Asian background with long hair standing out the front of an HSBC bank branch

props.synopsis: Australians are continuing to lose their life savings to a long-running "spoofing" scam targeting customers of banking giant HSBC.Â Â

title.children: 'Oh my God, another one': A long-running text scam is still costing Australians their life savings

image.altText: A man holding a gun amid soldiers.

props.synopsis: As North Korea abandons the decades-long goal of reunification with the South, experts are tabling different interpretations on what lies ahead.

title.children: Gifts from Putin and a shift in rhetoric: Why experts think North Korea's war mongering has just turned real

image.altText: Kris Mietus and Prue Mayne speak about Marc Mietus.

props.synopsis: Police have issued a $500,000 reward for information about the suspected murder of a man missing from near Bundaberg since 2000.Â

title.children: Father of suspected murder victim makes emotional plea as police launch fresh search for evidence

image.altText: Christian Horner

props.synopsis: The Red Bull staffer who made a complaint against Christian Horner is stood down, as Horner responds to claims by Jos Verstappen that his son would walk away from the team.

title.children: Red Bull staffer suspended as Christian Horner responds to Jos Verstappen claims about his son's future

image.altText: Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden Facebook

props.synopsis: Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden has been suspended on full pay since late last year after being charged with the murder of his stepfather. Whether he gets a second term is inÂ the hands of 20,000-odd voters.Â

title.children: How can a councillor charged with murder run for re-election?

image.altText: A close-up photo of Elizabeth holding baby Mary and kissing her forehead.

props.synopsis: Ninety per cent of pregnancies are terminated when prenatal screening predicts Down syndrome. Liz Smith chose to continue with her pregnancy but says she has been traumatised by her experience with the medical system.

title.children: After Liz gave birth, a nurse asked her if she planned to take baby Mary home

image.altText: A cricket player bowling with the size of the ball blown up into a close up look graphic

props.synopsis: It is one of the most devastating weapons a fast bowler can own â but the art of swing is steeped in mystery and myths that only science can explain.

title.children: 'The whole mystery was revealed': The science of what makes a cricket ball swing explained

image.altText: Lance Corporal Jack Fitzgibbon in RAAF uniform with Australian flag behind him in official photo

props.synopsis: From his footy club to his father's political opponents, the NSW Hunter Valley community is paying tribute to the 33-year-old and sharing words of love for his grieving family.

title.children: Tributes shared for Lance Corporal Jack Fitzgibbon after RAAF parachute training death

image.altText: A mug shot of a man

props.synopsis: It's the second time in seven months someone in NSW has been released in an error and an investigation has been launched.Â

title.children: Inmate wrongly released from Sydney jail calls police after hearing about search on the news

image.altText: A black and white photograph showing two Australian nurses surrounded by Vietnamese children

props.synopsis: A new novel by bestselling US author Kristin Hannah remembers the forgotten nurses of the Vietnam War, whose service went unrecognised for decades.

title.children: These nurses risked their lives serving in Vietnam but their stories are largely forgotten
